explanations.A: (−3)³ is the same as (−3) ✕ (−3) ✕ (−3). Tackle this in stages: (−3) ✕ (−3) = ＋9 (because of like signs). Then putting this answer in place of the first two terms gives (＋9 ) ✕ (−3) = −27 (because of unlike signs).

explanations.A: This is -4 - -16 = -4 + 16 = 12. Which other calculation will equal -20?
explanations.B: Consider (−28) − (−4) ✕ 2. multiplication takes priority over addition, so working out (−4) ✕ 2 gives −8. Substituting this back in gives (−28) − (−8) = −28 ＋8 = −20, as required.
explanations.C: (-5)² = 25, so we have 25 + 5 = 30. Which calculation will equal -20?
explanations.D: −42 ÷ (−2) is positive 21, so we have 21 + 1 = 22. Which calculation will equal -20?

explanations.A: (-3)² = 9, so we have 9 - 11 = -2. Which calculation will equal -20?
explanations.B: This is -12 - -8 = -12 + 8 = -4. Which calculation will equal -20?
explanations.C: We have to do multiplication first so we get -28 - 8 (because -4 x -2 = 8). This is -36. Which calculation will equal -20?
explanations.D: Consider (−33) ÷ (−3) − 31. Division takes priority over subtraction, so working out (−33) ÷ (−3) gives ＋11 (like signs give a positive answer). Substituting this back in gives 11 − 31 = −20, as required.
